description: From Middle English wisliche, wislike, from Old English wīslīċe (“wisely”, adverb), equivalent to wise +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: wisely (comparative wiselier or more wisely, superlative wiseliest or most wisely)

entries.meaning: In a wise manner; using good judgement.
examples: She wisely decided to re-check her homework before submitting it.
